meanings.definition: Treat (a liquid) with heat to kill or slow the growth of bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The chef decided to pasteurise the milk before using it in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pasteurise milk to make it safe for drinking.
meanings.sent3: The milk was so scared of bacteria that it begged to be pasteurised.
meanings.sent4: The heat from the pasteurisation process was like a shield protecting the milk from harm.
meanings.sent5: The bubbling liquid danced happily as it underwent pasteurisation.

meanings.sent1: The dairy farm decided to pasteurise all their milk for safety reasons.
meanings.sent2: In order to sell their products, the company had to pasteurise the juice first.
meanings.sent3: The milk bottle felt like a superstar as it was chosen to be pasteurised.
meanings.sent4: The pasteurisation process was like a warm hug for the liquid, ensuring its purity.
meanings.sent5: The factory workers carefully monitored the pasteurisation of the liquid to perfection.

meanings.definition: To heat (a liquid) to a temperature that kills bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The health inspector reminded the restaurant to pasteurise the sauce before serving.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to pasteurise fruit juices to make them safe for consumption.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria in the liquid ran away in fear when they heard it was going to be pasteurised.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of pasteurisation was like a superhero fighting off the bacteria invaders.
meanings.sent5: The liquid transformed into a warrior, ready to face the heat of pasteurisation.
